content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 8 is:

1->2->4->8

This path uses 4 edges and has a length of 4. Note that this is the shortest path that includes node 8 and excludes the previous destination node. If you change the endpoint to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 4 is:

2->4

This path uses 1 edge and has a length of 1. Note that this is the shortest path that includes node 4 and excludes the previous destination node. If you change the endpoint to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.
